business.headline: Why middle class feels stuck between taxes and EMIs, explains CAThe burden is not just about taxes. Price hikes on fuel, food, education, and healthcare hit the middle class the hardest. Unlike the rich, they cannot hedge against inflation with high-value assets. Unlike the poor, they don't receive government relief.
Sensex down 500 points: Why is stock market falling today?At closing bell, indices opened marginally lower but kept sliding as the day went on. Sensex and Nifty declined over half a percent.

Will life, health insurance premiums become cheaper with zero GST proposal?Will zero GST on life and health insurance truly make premiums cheaper or will input credit losses and policy design dilute the benefits for most customers? Read to know what experts have to say.
Sensex down 350 points, Nifty below 25,000; Wipro, HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 380.59 points to 81,620.12, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 127.95 points to 24,956.25 as of 9:30 am.

Dream11, MPL suspend money-based games after Online Gaming Bill clears ParliamentReal-money gaming faces a knockout blow as Dream11, MPL, and Zupee halt money-based online games. Dream11 is also likely to follow suit after sweeping ban.

Less than 40% ITRs processed as government pushes deadline to September 15The Finance Ministry has pushed the ITR deadline to 15 September citing extensive changes in forms and utilities. But three months in, processing is still crawling at under 40%.

Sensex, Nifty gain for 6th straight session on GST reforms optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 142.87 points to 82,000.71 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 33.20 points to settle at 25,083.75.

Key panel okays scrapping of 12%, 28% GST slabs; 90% goods may get cheaperIn a key meeting held on Thursday, the panel of state ministers accepted the Centre's plan to reduce the four-rate system to two main slabs of 5% and 18%.

How can retirees stay safe from risky 'too good to be true' schemes?Many retirees fall prey to schemes that seem too good to be true, chasing high returns without understanding the risks. Protecting your savings requires caution, awareness, and smart investment choices.

Why zero GST on insurance premiums doesn't mean cheaper policies for youOn the surface, removing GST on insurance premiums seems like a big relief, but experts caution that the outcome may not be what many are expecting.

EPFO withdrawal, pension or transfer: How to choose the right PF formEPFO members often get confused about which form to fill for withdrawals, transfers, or pension claims. Using the right form not only saves time but also avoids delays or rejection of your application.

CA explains why 80% of emergency funds don't work when neededMost people believe they are financially prepared for tough times, but when a real crisis hits, their so-called emergency funds often fall short. A chartered accountant explains why this happens and how to fix it.

entertainment.headline: Salman Khan begins Battle of Galwan shoot in Ladakh, director shares glimpseActor Salman Khan has started shooting for his much-anticipated film 'Battle of Galwan' in Ladakh. A day after a behind-the-scenes photo went viral, director Aapoorva Lakhia shared updates on social media.

Chiranjeevi turns 70: Pawan Kalyan to Allu Arjun, celebs wish Megastar on birthdayMegastar Chiranjeevi is celebrating his 70th birthday today, August 22. His brother Pawan Kalyan, Allu Arjun and several others conveyed their wishes to the superstar.

Alia Bhatt, Soni Razdan enjoy beach holiday with Shaheen and her boyfriend. PicsShaheen Bhatt gave fans a glimpse of her beach getaway with sister Alia Bhatt on Instagram. The two were joined by their mother, Soni Razdan.

Rapper Lil Nas X arrested, hospitalised after roaming streets in underwear: ReportRapper Lil Nas X was arrested and hospitalised for a possible overdose after he was seen wandering Ventura Boulevard in Los Angeles in his underwear. A video of him walking on the streets at midnight has emerged online.

Mammootty's brother overjoyed with fans' prayers: Anxieties have subsidedMammootty's brother, Ibrahim Kutty, shared a heartfelt note on the actor's recovery. He was moved to see the whole world pray for Mammootty's recovery.
Veteran Punjabi actor-comedian, Jaswinder Bhalla, dies at 65Veteran Punjabi actor-comedian Jaswinder Bhalla died on August 22 in Mohali. The cremation will take place on August 23.

Tollywood workers' strike ends after 18 days, Chiranjeevi thanks Revanth ReddyThe 18-day-long strike of Film Federation employees has finally come to an end. Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy intervened to pave the way for an amicable solution.

Millie Bobby Brown, Jake Bongiovi adopt a baby girl, congratulations pour inActor Millie Bobby Brown and husband Jake Bongiovi adopted a baby girl. The couple announced the news via a joint statement on social media.

Vivek Agnihotri denies jibe at Saif's son: But nobody should name child TaimurVivek Agnihotri, in an interview, clarified he did not take a jibe at Saif Ali Khan and Kareena Kapoor's son Taimur in his film 'The Bengal Files'. The director also expressed his opinion on the naming of children after historical figures.
In a Sholay remake, who'd be Thakur and Gabbar: Sherlock Holmes finds outAt 221B, the hunt for Thakur and Gabbar begins, and the casting debate turns deadly serious.

Brent Hinds, Mastodon Guitarist, dies at 51 in Atlanta motorcycle crash Brent Hinds, co-founder of Grammy-winning band Mastodon, died at 51 in an Atlanta motorcycle crash. The music world mourns his creative influence and upcoming projects with Fiend Without a Face.

Badlapur 2, Shiddat 2, Thama - Prime Video and Maddock team up for mega dealPrime Video has announced an exclusive multi-year licensing deal with Maddock Films for eight upcoming movies. This partnership will bring Indian films to audiences in over 240 countries shortly after their theatrical release.

Lilly Singh to star in Hasan Minhaj's coming-of-age film 'Best of the Best'Canadian YouTuber and comedian Lilly Singh will feature in the Netflix original 'Best of the Best', penned by Hasan Minhaj and directed by Lena Khan. The story follows two childhood friends who join their college's Bollywood dance team.

Vishwambhara teaser: Chiranjeevi's film promises high-octane action with grand VFXAhead of South superstar Chiranjeevi's birthday, the teaser for his much-awaited film 'Vishwambhara' released on Thursday. The makers confirmed that the film will release in Summer 2026.

Kylie Jenner, Timothee Chalamet dismiss breakup rumours with Budapest coffee dateKylie Jenner and Timothee Chalamet dismissed breakup rumours with their recent coffee outing in Budapest. A picture of their date has emerged online.

Rocky Jaiswal denies taking advantage of Hina Khan's fame: I don't have insecurityMonths after their marriage, Rocky Jaiswal dismissed talk of taking advantage of actor Hina Khan's fame in a recent interview. He also responded to claims of being insecure about Hina's success.

Boxing legend Mike Tyson approached for Bigg Boss 19: SourceBoxing legend Mike Tyson is expected to be a part of 'Bigg Boss 19'. He has been approached for the show, and the makers are waiting for his confirmation.

Akshay Kumar says he fasts on Monday for energy and better healthActor Akshay Kumar revealed his weekly fasting ritual and early dinner habit at a book launch. He emphasised on digestion and balanced health over extreme diets.

Most memorable Bigg Boss contestants and what they are doing now'Bigg Boss' has proved to be a game-changer for many celebrities, including Shehnaaz Gill, Nora Fatehi and Sunny Leone, amongst many others. Ahead of 'Bigg Boss 19', here is a look at the show's most memorable contestants and what they are doing now.

general news.headline: Pick up stray dogs, but release after sterilisation: Supreme Court modifies orderStray dogs verdict: The Supreme Court said stray dogs, which are picked up, must be released after immunisation, except those that are infected with rabies or exhibit aggressive behaviour.

No feeding stray dogs in public: 5 big points from Supreme Court orderThe Supreme Court today directed that stray dogs cannot be fed in public areas and must be fed only in designated zones. The top court also asked civic bodies to create feeding areas for dogs in municipal wards.

India a 'laundromat' for Kremlin, doesn't need Russian oil: Trump adviser NavarroThe longtime Trump aide said Indian refiners are cashing in while fuelling the war. "They don't need oil -- it's a refining profiteering scheme," he argued. Navarro mixed criticism with praise for India's leadership, but pressed New Delhi to change course.

DK Shivakumar breaks into RSS anthem in Karnataka Assembly, BJP MLAs cheerKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar sparked a stir in the Assembly by singing the RSS anthem, drawing cheers from BJP MLAs. The move went viral with users speculating on its political message. Just days earlier, Shivakumar had dismissed RSS's history while defending the Congress's legacy.

Indians used gold coins in Harappan, Rig Vedic period, 3,000 years before believedNew research by India's top archaeologist BR Mani reveals that the Harappans and Vedic people were using gold coins, known as Nishka. The coins were used as currency, trade assets, ritual offerings and status symbols, says Mani. This discovery pushes back the timeline of Indian gold coinage by nearly three millennia, which would reshape our understanding of the subcontinent's ancient economy and culture.

Hitting Trump where it hurts, China's soybean shift to Brazil strains US farmersAfter Russia and China rolled out the red carpet for Indian goods, another Brics nation, Brazil — which has also faced tariffs of up to 50% similar to those on India — is now replacing the US as Beijing's main soybean supplier, according to reports.

Suicide helplines in India: Lifelines or missed calls?Each unanswered helpline call is not just silence, it is a life teetering on the edge, left alone in its darkest hour. India's rising suicide numbers demand more than token helplines; they demand a system that listens, cares, and responds.

India vs Pakistan sporting ties: 5 big questions after new government policyThe India-Pakistan match at the Asia Cup is likely to go ahead following the government's new policy on hosting and competing in sports involving Pakistan. But it raises serious questions: should international sporting credibility come before national interest and security?

Watch: India shines in video captured by Shubhanshu Shukla from spaceShukla shared a timelapse video capturing the subcontinent in a spellbinding sequence that blends natural wonders with the unique vantage point of life aboard the International Space Station (ISS).

Why did students in Bangladesh turn towards fundamentalism?How did Bangladesh's campuses come to be dominated by fundamentalist students by 2024? The situation was a stark reversal from the progressive activism of 1971. Decades of dynastic politics and the erosion of independent leadership due to a ban on campus elections were exploited by fundamentalists.

Live: PM Modi's mega roadshow in Gaya, Nitish Kumar with himPM Modi Bihar-Bengal visit Live: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit poll-bound Bihar and West Bengal on Friday to lay the foundation stone and inaugurate infrastructure and development projects worth around Rs 18,000 crore, with projects worth approximately Rs 13,000 crore allocated to Bihar alone.

As Modi govt tables bills to prevent 'rule from jail', why Opposition smells a ployThe Modi government calls the three bills introduced by home minister Amit Shah as anti-corruption reform while critics allege executive overreach and political misuse
In a Sholay remake, who'd be Thakur and Gabbar: Sherlock Holmes finds outAt 221B, the hunt for Thakur and Gabbar begins, and the casting debate turns deadly serious.

More trouble for Kerala Congress MLA, trans woman alleges he wanted to rape herA trans woman has accused Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil of sexual harassment. Similar allegations were earlier made by Rini Ann George and Honey Bhaskaran, after which Mamkootathil resigned as the state Youth Congress chief.

Dream11, MPL suspend money-based games after Online Gaming Bill clears ParliamentReal-money gaming faces a knockout blow as Dream11, MPL, and Zupee halt money-based online games. Dream11 is also likely to follow suit after sweeping ban.

Intruder scales Parliament wall, caught by security, being questioned: SourcesAn intruder scaled a wall with a ladder and entered the Parliament premises around 6:30 am on Thursday before being caught by security near Garud Dwar.
Why dengue is sending more adults to the ICUProlonged screen-time, device heat, electromagnetic radiation and poor posture are now known to trigger severe skin conditions

Chiranjeevi turns 70: Pawan Kalyan to Allu Arjun, celebs wish Megastar on birthdayMegastar Chiranjeevi is celebrating his 70th birthday today, August 22. His brother Pawan Kalyan, Allu Arjun and several others conveyed their wishes to the superstar.

You are all upset with my gaming: Class 12 Lucknow student dies by suicideThe incident comes at a time when a law banning all forms of online money games, which cleared Parliament on Thursday, has sparked a massive debate on social media.

Trump administration reviews 55 million US visa holders for possible deportationThe Trump administration is reviewing 55 million US visa holders for potential violations, citing overstays, criminal activity, or terrorism risks, sparking concerns among immigrants and advocacy groups nationwide.

High salaries, empty classrooms: Why government school teachers stay absentIndia pays its government school teachers high salaries, yet teacher absenteeism remains widespread in India. Around 25% of teachers remain absent on average, while 25% more stay present but don't teach. Economist Karthik Muralidharan explains how politics, centralisation, and weak accountability fuel the crisis.

Pressured to marry, ex-UP pradhan chops lover into 7 pieces, dumps in wellFrustrated by a widow's repeated demands for marriage, a former village pradhan and his nephew murdered her in Jhansi's Kishorpura village, chopped the body into seven pieces, stuffed them into sacks, and dumped them in a well and near a bridge.

Rapper Lil Nas X arrested, hospitalised after roaming streets in underwear: ReportRapper Lil Nas X was arrested and hospitalised for a possible overdose after he was seen wandering Ventura Boulevard in Los Angeles in his underwear. A video of him walking on the streets at midnight has emerged online.

US freezes foreign trucker visas after deadly crash involving Indian driverThe US has paused issuing worker visas for commercial truck drivers after a fatal crash involving an Indian driver, with Secretary Rubio citing safety risks and Trump enforcing English-proficiency rules.

Salman Khan begins Battle of Galwan shoot in Ladakh, director shares glimpseActor Salman Khan has started shooting for his much-anticipated film 'Battle of Galwan' in Ladakh. A day after a behind-the-scenes photo went viral, director Aapoorva Lakhia shared updates on social media.

Chiranjeevi turns 70: Pawan Kalyan to Allu Arjun, celebs wish Megastar on birthdayMegastar Chiranjeevi is celebrating his 70th birthday today, August 22. His brother Pawan Kalyan, Allu Arjun and several others conveyed their wishes to the superstar.

sports.headline: India left-arm spinner Gouher Sultana retires from all forms of cricketIndia left-arm spinner Gouher Sultana has announced her retirement from all forms of cricket. She represented India in 50 ODIs and 37 T20Is.

Explained: Why government has given green signal to India vs Pakistan at Asia CupThe Indian government, in its latest diktat, has allowed sporting teams to play against Pakistan in multinational events. Why did the government make this move despite its dwindling relationship with its neighbour?

Right after Asia Cup squad announcement, BCCI replaces 2 national selectorsBCCI is set to replace two senior national selectors from the men's committee just days after the announcement of India's Asia Cup squad. However, Ajit Agarkar is likely to remain as the chief selector till 2026.

India vs Pakistan sporting ties: 5 big questions after new government policyThe India-Pakistan match at the Asia Cup is likely to go ahead following the government's new policy on hosting and competing in sports involving Pakistan. But it raises serious questions: should international sporting credibility come before national interest and security?

Dravid recalls Ashwin's video on batting against spin, jokes about backlashFormer India cricketer and head coach Rahul Dravid recalled Ravichandran Ashwin's YouTube video on playing spin in India from 2023 during the middle of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia. Ashwin had received backlash for his video after Australia won the third Test in Indore.

Asia Cup 2025: Abhishek Sharma gears up for his biggest test yetAbhishek Sharma earned a spot in India's Asia Cup 2025 squad after a string of explosive T20I performances. Now, the young opener faces his toughest challenge yet — proving himself on the big stage.

Rinku Singh finds form before Asia Cup, hits rapid hundred in UP T20 LeagueRinku Singh played a stunning unbeaten century to help Meerut Mavericks chase 168 runs in the UP T20 League. His heroic innings comes amid pressure over his Asia Cup selection and recent poor form.

Samson preparing for new Asia Cup role? Keeper slots at No.5 in local leagueSanju Samson moved down to the No. 5 position in the batting order in Kerala Cricket League. Is he preparing for a new role for the Asia Cup?

Ravi Bishnoi: From India's trump card to T20I outsider. What went wrong?Ravi Bishnoi could not find a place in India's Asia Cup squad. An underwhelming IPL 2025, combined with Varun Chakravarthy's rapid rise has forced the former World No.1 T20I bowler to the sidelines of the Indian squad.

WWE's Undertaker set to join Salman Khan's Big Boss: ReportsWWE legend The Undertaker may join Salman Khan on Bigg Boss 19, if reports are to be believed. If the move goes through, it would create a groundbreaking crossover between wrestling and Bollywood.

Asia Cup 2025: Abhishek Sharma gears up for his biggest test yetAbhishek Sharma earned a spot in India's Asia Cup 2025 squad after a string of explosive T20I performances. Now, the young opener faces his toughest challenge yet — proving himself on the big stage.

Ravi Bishnoi: From India's trump card to T20I outsider. What went wrong?Ravi Bishnoi could not find a place in India's Asia Cup squad. An underwhelming IPL 2025, combined with Varun Chakravarthy's rapid rise has forced the former World No.1 T20I bowler to the sidelines of the Indian squad.

WWE's Undertaker set to join Salman Khan's Big Boss: ReportsWWE legend The Undertaker may join Salman Khan on Bigg Boss 19, if reports are to be believed. If the move goes through, it would create a groundbreaking crossover between wrestling and Bollywood.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
